alert.note: Alert for Wayne; White (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 10:27PM CST until February 19 at 9:45AM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Illinois... Little Wabash River at Carmi affecting White, Wayne and Gallatin Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Skillet Fork River at Wayne City affecting White and Wayne Counties. .Heavy rainfall over the past 24 hours will cause the Little Wabash and Skillet Fork Rivers to rise above flood stage through late this week. For the Little Wabash River...including Carmi...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Skillet Fork River...including Wayne City...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skillet Fork River at Wayne City. * WHEN...Until late Saturday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM CST Thursday the stage was 14.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 18.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
